intro: Michelia chongjiangensis, commonly known as the Chongjiang michelia, is a rare evergreen shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has simple, opposite, and elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
